example: The approaching examination created a tense atmosphere on the campus.

meaning: n. 水圈；大气中的水汽
example: All the water of the earth's surface is included in the hydrosphere.
The lithosphere and the hydrosphere together form the earth's surface.
Hydrogen and Oxygen are gases.
Oxide is a part of our daily life.
Soft drinks usually contain carbon dioxide.
Two parts hydrogen, one part oxygen, you'll get water everytime.
He is the core of the working group.
The crust on the snow was thick enough for us to walk on it.

meaning: n./v. 地幔；斗篷；披风；覆盖
example: Parents often use mantles for their babies to keep warm.
The captain determine the latitude and longitude of his ship.
Our position is 40 degrees north latitude.

meaning: n. 地平线；[~s]眼界；见识 (horizontal adj. 水平的；broaden sb.'s horizons 开阔眼界)
example: I could see a ship on the horizon.
We're currently flying at an altitude of 8,000 meters.

meaning: n. 灾难 (a disaster film/movie 灾难片)
example: There was a great flood disaster in East China.
A mishap prevented him from attending the routine company meeting.
If the forecast had been wrong, the consequences could have been catastrophic.

meaning: n. 灾难；不幸的事 (cause a calamity 酿成灾祸)
example: A hurricane would be a calamity for this low-lying coastal region.

meaning: v. 使遭受危险；危及 (endangered adj. 濒临灭绝)
example: If you work hard without rest, you will endanger your health.

meaning: v. 危害；危及 (jeopardise sb.'s life 危及某人生命)
example: If you are rude to the boss, your chances of success may be jeopardised.
Jealousy is an extremely destructive emotion.
What changed the equation that year was El Nino.
The flowers are grown in the greenhouse.

meaning: n. 现象 (复数：phenomena；a natural/social phenomenon 自然/社会现象)
example: Snow is an almost unknown phenomenon in Egypt.
The boy put his hand into the money bag and drew out a pebble.

meaning: n. 磁铁；吸铁石 (magnetic adj. 磁的，有磁性的；有吸引力的)
example: He picked all the pins up with a magnet.
This mountain area is rich in iron ore.
China is rich in mineral resources.
They used marble to build the steps.
Have you bought the quartz clock?

meaning: n. 花岗岩 (bite on granite 白费力气；徒劳无功)
example: His grave is made of granite.

meaning: n. 一阵狂风；（情感的）迸发
example: A gust of wind blew the leaves off the trees.
We are enjoying the cool breeze that comes from the lake.
The monsoon brings rain to us.
We got our roof blown off in a gale last night.
The hurricane flung their motorboat upon the rocks.
When a tornado touches the ground, it does a lot of damage.
The typhoon is gathering strength.
The volcano erupted and two small towns were buried under meters of hot ash.

meaning: v. 爆发；喷发；（斑疹等）突然出现
example: Hot lava erupted from the crust.
Some types of minerals are made when magma cools and solidifies.
His theory violates current thermodynamic laws.
The smog was so bad that school children were advised to stay indoors.

meaning: n./v. （难闻有害的）烟，气体；发怒，愤怒
example: Petrol fumes from cars are poisoning the atmosphere.

meaning: n. 薄雾；水汽；使视线模糊的东西
example: She could hardly recognize her son from her mist of tears.
A terrible tsunami followed the earthquake.
Many areas in Africa have suffered severe drought this year.
Since the flooding began last month, seventeen people have died state wide.
A torrent of water poured down the mountain.
Several countries in Eastern Europe are counting the losses caused by yesterday's earthquake.

meaning: adj. 地震的；地震引起的
example: The discovery of seismic activity suggests geological activity could provide large amounts of heat and minerals.
Yesterday's avalanche destroyed several trees.
He climbed a tree to view the surrounding terrain.

meaning: n./v. 风景；地貌；对...进行景观美化
example: The trees and the mountains made the landscape very beautiful.
It is generally thought that Columbus discovered the American continent.
The cave was used by smugglers in the 18th century.
The narrow path leads to a wooden hut on the cliff.
The glacier dislocated the great stones.
In the swamp we were beset by mosquitoes.
The Nile Delta used to be a fertile land.
